body_html:
Is the usage the same in nvidia-smi? Or are you running it on one card exclusively? This might not be a tensorflow issue so I recommend filing a question on stack overflow. In the mean time you could try some primitive troubleshooting by physically removing and swapping cards to clarify if it is a bug caused by device id allocation (doubt it) or mobo or the card itself.

It may just run hotter and slower because of the cooling for the card or the power consumption. Monitor through nvidia-smi and when you are sure it is a tensorflow issue then I would suggest re-filing as this might get closed! Good luck!

body:
Is the usage the same in nvidia-smi? Or are you running it on one card exclusively? This might not be a tensorflow issue so I recommend filing a question on stack overflow. In the mean time you could try some primitive troubleshooting by physically removing and swapping cards to clarify if it is a bug caused by device id allocation (doubt it) or mobo or the card itself. 

It may just run hotter and slower because of the cooling for the card or the power consumption. Monitor through nvidia-smi and when you are sure it is a tensorflow issue then I would suggest re-filing as this might get closed! Good luck!
